page.title: 08GLASSHOUSE MILL - PAST
page.content: Glasshouse Mill began as a corn mill, then in 1814 it became a flax mill. In 1828 the Metcalfes bought the Mill and operated it until 1914. During their time at the Mill the Metcalfes added to the buildings;at the peak of its business the Mill employed 400 people, and produced a variety of linen threads, they also built houses for their workers around the Mill which became known as Glasshouses and a school for their employees' children. They were very benevolent employers as they were concerned with the welfare of their workers and their families. When the Atkinsons bought the Mill in 1914 they started producing string instead of flax to meet an increase in the demand for string. The Mill stopped production in 1972.
